artist: Master HB with a Griffin's Head; Probably active in the workshop of Lucas Cranach the Elder
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
inscription: Monogram at lower left mostly illegible; identified as HB with griffin or HBS
provenance:
?Collection, England. [1] Dr. Ehrenfest, Vienna, Austria. Hans Purrmann (1880-1966, Berlin, Germany by 1925. Walter Ochsenbein, Zurich, Schweiz by 1956; [2] (Richard F. Zinser, Forest Hills, New York); sold to MIA in 1956.

[1] 1921 in Berliner Handel. See von der Osten no. 135.

[2] letter from Walter Ochsenbein in object file regarding payment for painting mentioning Zinser.
text: The figure of Venus, goddess of love, is based on a print from Albrecht Dürer’s treatise on human proportion (Nuremberg, 1528). But Dürer’s figural ideal is transformed into something wholly original in the hands of the Master HB, a German painter known today only by his initials. HB paints the bodies of Venus and Cupid as though they are constructed of strange, tectonic shapes; their bodies twist and turn in contorted positions in a compressed space in the picture’s foreground. These unnaturally muscled bodies and mannered poses are meant by the artist to demonstrate his unique imagination and skills.
title: Venus and Cupid
